**`How to access the SkyClient folder:`**
**Windows**: Hit `Windows Key + R` and type in `%appdata%`. Open the `.minecraft` folder, then go to the `skyclient` folder.
**Mac**: On the bar at the top of your screen in Finder, click Go, then click Go to Folder and type `~/Library/Application Support/Minecraft/skyclient`, then hit enter.
**Linux**: if you use Linux and you don't know this, stop using Linux.


**`Exit Code 0:`**
Go into the `logs` folder and upload `latest.log`
If you don't see that file, look for it. Any other file will be useless.

**`Exit Code 1 (or anything other than 0):`**
Go into the crash-reports folder and upload the latest current crashlog.

If you are crashing, we need the following:

``How to access the SkyClient folder:``
Windows: Hit ``Windows Key + R`` and type in ``%appdata%``. Open the ``.minecraft`` folder, then go to the ``skyclient`` folder.
Mac: On the bar at the top of your screen in Finder, click Go, then click Go to Folder and type ``~/Library/Application Support/Minecraft/skyclient``, then hit enter.
Linux: if you use Linux and you don't know this, there's something wrong with you


``Exit Code 0:``
Go into the ``logs`` folder and upload ``latest.log``
If you don't see that file, look for it. Any other file will be useless.

``Exit Code 1 (or anything other than 0):``
Go into the crash-reports folder and upload the latest current crashlog.

Hypixel has removed the locations of Griffin Burrows from the public API. As such, any and all mods that formerly touted features of finding Griffin Burrows via an API search (Skytils most significantly) no longer does so, and any mods that claim to do so (regardless of distribution method) should be considered too good to be true until Griffin Burrows locations are confirmed to return to the public Hypixel API.

In the meantime, you can enable Skytils' Griffin Burrows ***particle-based*** waypoints via `/st config`.

The old launcher can be installed from here:
<https://launcher.mojang.com/download/MinecraftInstaller.msi>

To fix low dungeon FPS:
1. Make sure you don't have the mod SBCustomMobTex installed.
2. Disable the dungeon map in `/neumap`. If you still want a dungeon map, use the one from `/skytils` > Dungeons > Dungeon Map.
3. Please make a ticket in <#931624995522773032>, instead of asking for help in general chat.

MusicPlayer's option called "Toggle menue overlay" overrides Patcher's "Smart Disconnect" and "Open to LAN Replacement" configs. Please disable MusicPlayer's "Toggle menue overlay" by pressing `F8` in-game, pressing the cog on the upper right corner, and pressing the button labeled "Toggle menue overlay" until it is not highlighted green. Then exit MusicPlayer's menus and go back to the pause screen to confirm that everything is back to normal.

If you do not have MusicPlayer, make sure Patcher's "Smart Disconnect" and "Open to LAN Replacement" configs are enabled in the first place. Otherwise, if none of the above situations apply to you, disregard this message—another mod outside of SkyClient is probably causing this issue.

Here's a list of what MusicPlayer supports, as well as the instruction manual after you press `F8` in-game to access its menus. ***__And no, support for Spotify (free or Premium) is not on that list—please check `-mod craftify` for an in-game Spotify player__***: https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/887818760126345246/989211814753632346/Screen_Shot_2022-06-22_at_12.53.05629_PM_Eastern_Daylight_Time_GMT-04.00.png

What does this mean for you?

1. Price Change: Unfortunately, though we didn't want to do this, the new management discovered that a price of $5 or 5 million Skyblock coins was not sustainable. We are reducing the price by $5 or 5 million Skyblock coins, bringing the total amount to $0!

2. More FPS: Our coding cats were playing a prank on us, and cipher technology polymorphed your game into a turtle. We have reverted this change.

3. Less Features & Slower Updates: Our patent for sticky replication technology was revoked, meaning we can no longer market features from freebies at a premium. You may need to download other mods to supplement for this loss.

4. Worse Features: Studies show that features that do not exist underperform when compared to features that do exist.

Analytics show that BSMod is a success! It wouldn't be possible without you, the gullible Skyblock player. 🤣

Purchase logs show about 35,000 buyers at $5 each, netting us $175,000. 🤑
Cosmetic purchases show about 10,000 colored characters at $4 each, netting us about $40,000. 🤑

Regrettably, our counter for the number of times your colored character reset broke... We are unable to provide a quantifiable measure of profits, but just know we took your money! 😅

BSMod was a very profitable endeavor and our team at BetaDawn LLC is proud to have made so much money off BSMod. We'll catch you guys next year on 04/01/2023 for our next venture!

Craftify Errors and Answers

Q: How do I log in?
Q: How do I use Craftify?
Q: How does Craftify work?
A: run /craftify in game and then go to login tab and click login

Q: I logged in and it still is not showing up
A: Are you listening to a song?
— No > Craftify wont show up unless you are listening to a song or you have always show rendering mode turn on
— Yes > Craftify by default wont show up in the config you can change the display mode in the config.
*If you aren't in any GUI and it still wont show up make sure you are logged into the correct account*
*If you are sure you are logged into the correct account then try restarting the game and if it still doesnt work report in the mod's Discord server by running `-discord boat`.*
*Another possibility of it not working is Spotify API is down—make sure that is not the case before reporting your issue.*

Q: Craftify is stuck on my screen even when there is no song!
A: If you downloaded a Craftify beta early on during its development, you had the old "default display mode" of "always show". You can change this to only when song is playing via the config.

Q: Craftify shows 'Media Not Found'!
A: Currently Craftify only supports albums, so you are likely listening to a Spotify podcast or video.
(Note: You can hide this message by changing "display mode" to "when song is found".)

Q: Controls aren't working!
A: Controls only work for Spotify Premium members, as Spotify has locked the music control API behind folks with Spotify Premium.

Q: Can Craftify send a message when a song changes?
A: Yes, in the config you can find the "Announce New Song" setting which has 3 different modes to choose from.

Q: Can I change where Craftify shows up to?
A: Yes, there are select modes in the config for where the UI should show. If you have another one that you think could be useful, you can suggest it in the mod's discord (`-discord boat`), but the current ones are the most popular ones requested.

How to resolve fonts displaying as squares:
1: Join a singleplayer or multiplayer world
2: Type /patcher in chat to open Patcher's GUI
3: Click the search icon in the top right
4: Search "Optimized Font Renderer"
5: Disable the option that appears

Text should now display correctly.

Send a screenshot of your mods folder, so that we can know if you have any mods that aren't good for FPS or if you don't have the mods that help with FPS. If you don't know how to access it, watch https://youtu.be/Y7AyoDMsFdY

Type `/neustats` IN-GAME, and paste the result here. Do not copy the chat message it sends, it automatically copies the information we need.

Go to `Video Settings` (escape key -> `Options` -> `Video Settings`) and change the following:
Use VBOS: `ON`

Then, in the `Performance` tab, change the following:

Smart Animations: `ON`
Render Regions: `ON`
Smooth FPS: `OFF`
Smooth World: `OFF`
Fast Render: `OFF` (It does help with FPS, but it breaks so many features in many Skyblock mods that you should really not turn it on, unless you want half of your mods to break)
Fast Math: `OFF` (since this breaks things more than it helps)

Run `/patcher` (ingame, of course) and mess with the settings. A full list of its settings can be found here: https://github.com/LizzyMaybeDev/Patcher-Explanation

If you have 4GB or less RAM in your computer, go to your SkyClient profile in the installations tab in the vanilla launcher, click `Advanced Settings`, and in the JVM Arguments box, replace `-Xmx3G` with `-Xmx2G`

If you are ever encountering a technical issue, follow the following steps to get the best assistance we can provide:

***What did you do?***
Tell us in exact detail what you have done to get to the point where you are now.

***What do you think?***
What did you except was going to happen? When you pressed "Close", did the game actually crash?

***What do you know?***
Do you have any log files or screenshots related to your issue? The more we know the better-there is no such thing as too much information revolving around a technical issue.

***What did you try?***

Have you attempted any fixes by yourself in the past? Tell us about them!

Here's why we encourage this habit of asking questions instead of the far too common "can anyone please help me" with no further elaboration: https://dontasktoask.com/

(Disclaimer: while there is one other JSON file inside the `.minecraft/` folder that stores personally identifying information in the form of login tokens called `launcher_accounts.json`, SkyClient staff will ***__never__*** ask for that file under any circumstances, and no one else should. If you're on macOS and this is your first time experiencing a white screen bug, please run `ulimit -c unlimited` in the Terminal as a temporary fix—regardless of whether your Mac machine runs on Apple Silicon (ie any M1 variant, M2) or Intel (ie i9, i7, i5, etc.). Then relaunch Minecraft.

If the issue persists, please type `.thanos` in this channel for further steps on the Thanos method in order to narrow down which mod(s) is/are causing the white screen, as it is different for every person. Repeat the Thanos method until you've found the mod(s) that triggers the white screen, and then commit the mod's name to memory—the white screen bug can and will come back sooner or later.

————————

If this is not your first time experiencing this issue, we will assume you already know which command to run and which mod(s) is/are causing the white screen (again, it is different for every individual player). All you need to do is:

— run `ulimit -c unlimited` in the Terminal
— move the mod(s) to a more familiar folder (usually your Desktop)
— relaunch Minecraft without those mods
— press the "Quit Game" button within the Minecraft window.***__this step is very important!___**
— bring those mods back into your mods folder
— relaunch Minecraft once again
— rinse and repeat when Minecraft runs into the white screen bug again.

If you get stuck between steps 3 and 4, start again at step 1.

Good luck, as the white screen bug has been a relatively new issue within our tickets, and most of this information was provided by more experienced macOS players.

Before doing anything, we recommend using PolyMC over MultiMC. PolyMC is an improved fork with an actually decent group of people owning it, and should be getting very good improvements very soon.

Firstly, create a PolyMC instance and click Install Forge on the instance settings. You should already know how to do this if you're using PolyMC. After that, select the instance you just created in the PolyMC main menu and click "Instance Folder". This folder you just opened will be referred to as POLYMC PATH/INSTANCE NAME for the rest of this tutorial. There should be a folder called .minecraft in that folder. If there is not, launch Minecraft before following the rest of this tutorial.
Then...
Windows:
Type in cmd: `mklink /J "POLYMC PATH/INSTANCE NAME/.minecraft" "%APPDATA%/.minecraft/skyclient"`

Linux:
Type in Terminal: `ln -s "~/.minecraft/skyclient" "POLYMC PATH/INSTANCE NAME/minecraft"`

macOS:
Type in Terminal: `ln -s "~/Library/Application Support/minecraft/skyclient" "POLYMC PATH/INSTANCE NAME/.minecraft"`

If it worked correctly, a new `.minecraft` folder linked to the Skyclient folder should be in `POLYMC PATH/INSTANCE NAME`.

That's it! Just run your new instance and have fun using SkyClient in PolyMC / MultiMC!

To fix the problem:
1. Go to <https://account.xbox.com/en-us/settings>
2. Navigate to the `Xbox One/Windows 10 Online Safety` tab. If you are under 18, you may need a parent or guardian to help by getting them to create a family and add you to it.
3. From there, they should be able to enable multiplayer for your account.
4. Relaunch Minecraft and you should be able to join any multiplayer server.

Q: How much RAM should I allocate to Minecraft?
A:
— 3-4GB if you have 8GB+ available
— 3GB if you have 5-6GB available
— 2GB (default) if you have less than 4GB available

Q: Isn't having more RAM better?
A: No. Unless you are playing a heavily modded 1.16 modpack, your game is almost never going to need more than 4GB. By allocating more than 4GB, Java will end up wasting memory and this usually results in worse performance. Also, by allocating more RAM to Java, you're preventing other apps on your computer from taking advantage of the RAM.

Q: B.. but I have 32GB of RAM on my computer, so I'm going to allocate 30GB of RAM to Minecraft and you can't stop me

A: Please please please don't do that, you cl🤡wn.

Conclusion: There's no advantage to having more than 4GB, so you should allocate 4GB (or less) just in case.

open your mods folder located at `.minecraft/skyclient/mods` and move ALL the mods somewhere else (preferably somewhere memorable, like your desktop)

if the issue still occours upload `latest.log` found in `.minecraft/skyclient/logs` (and if your game crashed, upload the latest crash report found in `.minecraft/skyclient/crash-reports` as well.)

if removing all your mods fixed the issue, put half of your mods back into the mods folder
If the issue occours again, half your current mods folder again and see if the issue still happens
if not, try the other half and repeat this process until the mod that is causing issues has been found
